results.abstract: Marshall Sella profile of Wes Anderson, director whose latest film is The Royal Tenenbaums; photos (L)
results.snippet: On a white-sky November day, Wes Anderson is lounging in a darkened studio in the Brill Building, formerly the silvery hub of Tin Pan Alley. His slight six-foot frame, all 155 pounds of it, is decked out in undersize beige corduroys and an undersize...
results.lead_paragraph: On a white-sky November day, Wes Anderson is lounging in a darkened studio in the Brill Building, formerly the silvery hub of Tin Pan Alley. His slight six-foot frame, all 155 pounds of it, is decked out in undersize beige corduroys and an undersize beige shirt; his auburn hair, once unruly, has settled into a subtle and rather stylish alliance of tamed cowlicks. ''We're doing a weird little recording session,'' he quietly explains. ''Yesterday, our editor was whistling along with the soundtrack, and I thought, Wait -- that's good!'' Anderson immediately realized that this was a perfect touch. It matched the sound in his head that, somehow, this crucial scene lacked. So, at this late stage in the editing process of his new movie, ''The Royal Tenenbaums'' -- and despite the fact that the Brill Building is teeming with musicians -- he has enlisted a ragtag assortment of crew members to lay down a whistling track, which will then be added to the score.

results.abstract: Michelle Slatalla column on buying glass Christmas tree ornaments online; drawing (M)
results.snippet: THE only thing I want for Christmas is something that disappeared years ago.     Let me describe it for you, so we can mourn together: It was a cheap frosted-glass ornament, painted with a scene of a tiny white church in a snowstorm. The words...
results.lead_paragraph: THE only thing I want for Christmas is something that disappeared years ago. Let me describe it for you, so we can mourn together: It was a cheap frosted-glass ornament, painted with a scene of a tiny white church in a snowstorm. The words ''Silent Night'' were written across the top of the steeple in silver glitter.

results.abstract: Article describes marketing tie-ins between automobile companies and other purveyors such as L L Bean and Nautica, which brought stylish upholstery to cars; offers suggestions for humorous co-branding strategies; drawings (M)

headline.main: Marketing Ties That Might Have Been

results.snippet: HE Levi's Gremlin, dressed in denim. The plus-size American Motors Matador wearing, somewhat uncomfortably, Oleg Cassini couture. The Frank Sinatra Edition Chrysler Imperial, which came with tapes of the Chairman's hits -- you could drive it your...
results.lead_paragraph: HE Levi's Gremlin, dressed in denim. The plus-size American Motors Matador wearing, somewhat uncomfortably, Oleg Cassini couture. The Frank Sinatra Edition Chrysler Imperial, which came with tapes of the Chairman's hits -- you could drive it your way. Marketing tie-ins are nothing new in the automobile business, but they seem to be expanding in scope and subject. As always, they hold the promise that the sum will somehow transcend the parts.

results.snippet: Cape Canaveral      Q. I would like to visit Cape Canaveral in the next month or so. Are tours available to the public and, if so, when? Will there be a liftoff or a similar event of note during this time? -- Rose Keyian, Vestal, N.Y.    A. The...
results.lead_paragraph: Cape Canaveral Q. I would like to visit Cape Canaveral in the next month or so. Are tours available to the public and, if so, when? Will there be a liftoff or a similar event of note during this time? -- Rose Keyian, Vestal, N.Y. A. The flight of the space shuttle Columbia was scheduled for Jan. 17, within the time frame you had in mind. But that flight has been moved to Feb. 14 -- changes in the launch schedules are common, a spokesman said -- so that additional work could be done on the Columbia. The mission of the astronauts aboard is to service the Hubble telescope, which was launched in 1990.

results.abstract: Three-member crew that was aboard International Space Station on Sept 11 come home to world changed by terrorism and war; American astronaut Frank L Culbertson Jr and Russians Vladimir N Dezhurov and Mikhail Tyurin return to Earth from fourth months in orbit (S)

headline.main: 3 Astronauts Return To a Different World

results.snippet: The three-member crew that was aboard the International Space Station on Sept. 11 came home today to a space center, and a world, changed by terrorism and war.    The space shuttle Endeavour swooped through thick afternoon clouds, returning the...
results.lead_paragraph: The three-member crew that was aboard the International Space Station on Sept. 11 came home today to a space center, and a world, changed by terrorism and war. The space shuttle Endeavour swooped through thick afternoon clouds, returning the American astronaut Frank L. Culbertson Jr. and the Russians Vladimir N. Dezhurov and Mikhail Tyurin to Earth from four months in orbit.

results.abstract: Astronaut Mike Massimino to take New York Mets' jersey with him when he makes his first trip on space shuttle Feb 14; photo (M)

headline.main: Fan's Tribute to the Mets Out of the World, Sort Of

results.snippet: The year of your seventh birthday can be a formative one. Just ask Mike Massimino.    Massimino was born in 1962 and was 7 when man walked on the moon and the Mets won the World Series. The miracles of '69 filled him with wonder and shaped him for...
results.lead_paragraph: The year of your seventh birthday can be a formative one. Just ask Mike Massimino. Massimino was born in 1962 and was 7 when man walked on the moon and the Mets won the World Series. The miracles of '69 filled him with wonder and shaped him for life. ''That was my influential year,'' he said.

results.abstract: Alexander Gorlin article on Stanely Kubrick's 1968 movie, 2001: A Space Odyssey, and its many eerie parallels to terrorist attack on World Trade Center; photo (M)

headline.main: Ideas & Trends; Of Tragedy and the Movie Monolith

keywords.name: creative_works
keywords.value: TWO THOUSAND ONE: A SPACE ODYSSEY (MOVIE)

results.snippet: FORGET Nostradamus, this was the year of Stanley Kubrick's movie ''2001: A Space Odyssey.'' It has more than fulfilled its terrifying prophecy of climactic events at the millennium.    An entire generation of baby boomers grew up with the film as...
results.lead_paragraph: FORGET Nostradamus, this was the year of Stanley Kubrick's movie ''2001: A Space Odyssey.'' It has more than fulfilled its terrifying prophecy of climactic events at the millennium. An entire generation of baby boomers grew up with the film as emblematic of the anticipation and apprehension of the year 2001 -- which technically began the millennium as opposed to the fanfare of the previous year's celebrations. The 1968 movie presented a darkly pessimistic view of humanity wrapped up in extraordinary imagery. Kubrick's insights into the destructive nature of mankind, a constant in all his films, has kept his message, and the movie, alive these past 30 years.
